name: PERMANENT MAKEUP 'The Void...It Creeps" ~ CD
description:
TRACKLISTING:
01. Pose Bust
02. Death Throes of A Cockroach
03. Not A Riot
04. Chemtrails
05. Signal or Noise
06. Faceplant
07. Pigeonhole
08. Headcount
09. Things Don't Just Work Out
10. Rock Paper Scissors
11. Don't Self Destruct
12. Deconstruct It

New Granada; NG032

FOR FANS OF: Wire, Mission of Burma, Sonic Youth, Fugazi

RELEASE DATE: February 26, 2013

US S&H - USPS Media Mail rate included in purchase price.
International S&H - Charges added at checkout.

REVIEWS:
"Like an American take on The Fall, played by folks who spent the ’90s smirking at the Monica Lewinsky scandal..." 
- YELLOW GREEN RED

"Roger Miller/Mission Of Burma-ish squalls, vocals with a D. Boon cadence at times, a few Fall touches.... It all adds up to something that's both edgy and melodic."
- SUBURBAN VOICE

"It’s a hell of a lot of fun." 
- COLLAPSE BOARD

name: THE WINTER SOUNDS 'Runner' ~ CD
description:
TRACKLISTING: 
01. The Sun Also Rises
02. Devils
03. Run From The Wicked
04. Old Man Old Woman
05. Bird On Fire
06. Shoulders Above
07. Young Love
08. Don't Change At All
09. Everything Wound Comes Home To Die
10. You Had A Bad Dream
11. Robots Marching
12. Carousel

New Granada; NG031

RELEASE DATE: November 27, 2012

US S&H - USPS Media Mail rate included in purchase price.
International S&H - Charges added at checkout.

REVIEWS: 
“a familiarly anthemic wall of guitars, electronics, strings and melancholy melodies that all add up to a no-brainer for critical acclaim.”
- THE NASHVILLE SCENE

“the fragility of a thousand compressed feelings, once all strewn about, but now collected and focused upon specific loves of tragic consequence and dimensions.”
- DAYTROTTER

name: RED ROOM CINEMA 'Apsis' ~ CD
description:
TRACKLISTING: 
01. Apsis I. Yoizuki  
02. Apsis II. The Observatory  
03. Apsis III. We Raise Our Eyes Between the Walls of Glass and Steel 
04. Apsis IV. A Storm of Meteorites 
05. White Arrows 
06. Shadows of A Forgotten City 

New Granada; NG030

FOR FANS OF: Explosions In The Sky, Maserati, Tristeza, Isis

RELEASE DATE: September 25, 2012

US S&H - USPS Media Mail rate included in purchase price.
International S&H - Charges added at checkout.

REVIEWS: 
"Sweeping rises in energy; climactic outbursts, and other quieter moments so touching, it feels like someone's suddenly opened his heart."
- MY OLD KENTUCKY BLOG

"(RRC is) adept at setting up moods and establishing gripping soundscapes." 
- PUNKNEWS.ORG

"RRC is both the calm before the storm and the wrecking force of a cyclone." 
- REAX 

"Red Room’s instrumentation, in its quietest moments, is luscious and velvety." 
- ABSOLUTE PUNK

name: KING OF SPAIN 'All I Did Was Tell Them The Truth And They Thought It Was Hell' ~ CD
description:
TRACKLISTING: 
01. Basement Fires
02. Motions
03. Green Eyes
04. Sans Refuge
05. Destiny Delayed
06. Ourselves In Another
07. Perception
08. Seamless Spotless Sidewalks (Redux)
09. All I Did Was Tell Them The Truth...
10. 1/26

New Granada; NG028

FOR FANS OF: 

RELEASE DATE: August 28, 2012

US S&H - USPS Media Mail rate included in purchase price.
International S&H - Charges added at checkout.

REVIEWS: 
"Hypnotic lead track "Motions" is a glorious song with chanted, oddly harmonied vocals and some epic guitar riffs that sound like a mix of U2's The Edge and Cocteau Twins' Robin Guthrie." 
- DIRECT CURRENT

"3.5 (of 5) stars" 
- ALLMUSIC.COM

"Although the group has grown bigger, the sound remains ethereal bedroom pop." 
- MAGNET

name: ALEXANDER & THE GRAPES 'Hemispheres' ~ CD
description:
TRACKLISTING: 
01. Another Year
02. Conscience
03. Conversation
04. East Coast
05. Where I Go
06. Chuck Stewart Has A Dream
07. Ocean
08. Salesman
09. Jordan
10. Can't Waste Too Much Time
11. Swan Song
12. Seeds

New Granada; NG027

FOR FANS OF: Bazan, Dr. Dog, The Band

RELEASE DATE: June 26, 2012

US S&H - USPS Media Mail rate included in purchase price.
International S&H - Charges added at checkout.

REVIEWS: 
"With its' big riffs and 90s college rock indie boy vocals, "East Coast" almost certainly would have been perfect for an episode of My So-Called Life, had the two met at the right time. That alas wasn't meant to be, but I'll still love the song for what it is, and what might have been." 
- FUZZY LOGIC

"Charos sings about falling short and other hallmarks of the human condition with the honesty and economy of
Gram Parsons and Kris Kristofferson. He doesn't have to confuse you into thinking he's brilliant." 
- CREATIVE LOAFING

"driving, lush, and bound to invoke a listener’s connection." 
- SUBURBAN APOLOGIST

"Alexander & The Grapes are sure to draw the attention for a rock and roll community for everyone to enjoy."
- SXSW.COM

description:

02. Stolen
03. Swimming
04. Little Birds

13. Wave To All Your Friends

New Granada; NG026

FOR FANS OF: Low, Ida, Carole King, Ron Sexsmith

RELEASE DATE: May 22, 2012

US S&H - USPS Media Mail rate included in purchase price.
International S&H - Charges added at checkout.

REVIEWS: 
"Rec Center isn't about rocking the house or shaking you to your core.  They're just about creating a sound unlike any other indie band and keeping the momentum going.  If you're in the mood to slow things down a bit, Rec Center is highly recommended."
- INDIEBALL

"A calming balm to the soul."
- CREATIVE LOAFING

"In a word. Fantastic."
- THE AQUARIAN

name: THE PAUSES 'A Cautionary Tale' ~ CD
description:
TRACKLISTING: 
01. Go North
02. Beyond Bianca
03. The Migration
04. Pull The Pin
05. The Leap Year
06. Hands Up
07. Little Kids
08. Goodbye, Winthorpe

New Granada; NG023

FOR FANS OF: Rilo Kiley, Metric, Feist, Pinback

RELEASE DATE: May 8, 2011

US S&H - USPS Media Mail rate included in purchase price.
International S&H - Charges added at checkout.

REVIEWS: 
"I adore every single goddamn thing about A Cautionary Tale" 
- THREE IMAGINARY GIRLS

"Besides being blessed with an extended gestation period, A Cautionary Tale also benefits from the presence of producer J. Robbins (Jawbox, Burning Airlines) and mastering engineer by T.J. Lipple (Aloha). The result is an extremely accomplished debut record that highlights The Pauses multi-faceted sound. Lesson here: Take your time, get good folks to help out and make the best record you can make."
- MY OLD KENTUCKY BLOG

REVIEWS: 
"Finds You In Love may be the most appropriate album title in the history of album titles.  The subtleties it conveys match perfectly the music that pours forth from the speakers when it plays."
- FENSE POST

(4/5 stars)
- ALTERNATIVE PRESS

Contains the same caliber of songwriting as any platinum selling artist.  Wood's vocals shine along with the instrumentation which combine to make an engaging album."
- MANUAL DEXTERITY ZINE
